intro: Euploca albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered euploca, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Euploca albiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
